settings.meetQuote: A hat reflects the essence of its wearer far more than does a pair of trousers, shoes or a jacket.
settings.heading: MEET THE DESIGNER
settings.meetMore: Keeping the art of hat-making alive with centuries-old techniques, and unchallenged innovative style and design.

settings.cultureQuote: A legacy of craftsmanship, carried on by a master.
settings.photoLeftTitle: Marcus and Maya for Vogue Scandinavia

settings.serviceNote: All other destinations will be billed  with actual freights and tariffs if applicable

settings.title: SERVICE REQUEST
settings.subtitle: Our Flagship store is now open Mondays to Saturdays from 10 am to 6 pm. We currently do not accept Hat Repairs. We will be posting update on this page if we do. Do not hesitate to contact us at 212 265 2887 if you need some tips to keep your hat in shape!
settings.stepAction2: INCLUDE THE FORM WITH YOUR HAT(S)
settings.stepDesc2: When shipping your hat make sure to properly pack your hat so that it arrives to our shop in the condition that you sent it.
settings.stepDesc3:
Worth & Worth
Orlando Palacios
247 West 38th Street,
Third Floor NYC
10018 NY

settings.title: Questions About Our Hat Services?
settings.assistanceText:
For service inquiries and tracking, please contact us at:
1-212-265-2887

settings.question: How can I purchase a gift card?
settings.answer:
Our gift cards are the easiest way to prove to someone special that you’re not only a good person but also one with excellent taste!
Our gift cards are available online (eshop section) and in store. Presented in Worth & Worth by Orlando Palacios packaging. Can be sent directly to the recipient or yourself.

settings.question: Do you ship internationally?
settings.answer:
Yes, we ship WORLDWIDE.

For all international shipments, returns and exchanges, the customer is responsible for all postage, Duties & Taxes. 

Should you need any further information, please do not hesitate to contact our customer service team at info@hatshop.com

settings.question: How long does it take for a custom hat to be made?
settings.answer: We require a 3-5 weeks lead time, this time may be extended during the Fall/Winter seasons. There are rush options with a 60% surcharge of the total price of the hat added.

settings.question: Can I order a hat over the phone?
settings.answer: Yes. We can conduct a phone fitting and assessment. Please feel free to contact us during our business hours our knowledgeable team members will be happy to assist you.

settings.question: How do I care for my new hat?
settings.answer: Click here to find out how to properly care for your hat.

settings.question: What are the advantages of purchasing a hat off the shelf and a custom hat?
settings.answer: At W&W there are not any advantages between the two because all of our hats are tailored to fit its owner perfectly. There are options to customize a hat off of the shelf but overall there is nothing like a custom made hat especially commissioned for you. Certain colors are only available through Worth & Worth’s custom Hats.

settings.question: How do I travel with my hat?
settings.answer: Worth & Worth offers a seamless traveling hat case with a purchase of $100 and over. If a hat case is not practical the best way to travel with your hat is to keep it on your head.

settings.question: Do you have readily available hats for purchase at your location?
settings.answer: Yes. We have our current seasonal collection on display for purchase with access to off-season materials and sizes on site.

settings.question: How to Order Hats
settings.answer:
We encourage you to order online by using the e-shop or by accessing this link 

If you would prefer to place an order by phone, call: 1.212. 265. 2887 

We will process your order and contact you to confirm your order and shipping date immediately for all order methods.

settings.question: Do you make all of your hats?
settings.answer: Yes. All of our hats are made at our Bowery flagship store and atelier in New York City. Our natural, renewable, and sustainable fur felt is pressed and imported from Italy consisting of hare fur, cashmere, and mink fur or any mixture thereof. Our beaver felt pressed and sent from Tennessee. Our straw is hand-woven in Ecuador, Italy, and the South Pacific.

settings.question: How much does a custom hat cost?
settings.answer: The starting price for a custom hare-fur felt hat is $650, a custom beaver fur felt starts at $925. For a custom straw hat please contact us for a quote, there are many types of straw that can be customized, and price points start at $450.

settings.question: What are your hours of operation?
settings.answer:
We are open Tuesday-Saturday: 11-7
and Sunday: 12-5.

settings.question: Are you open to the public or do I need to make an appointment?
settings.answer: We are open 6 days a week from Tuesdays to Sundays, feel free to come and explore our creations. If you would like to schedule a personal consultation we would be delighted to arrange a one-on-one fitting at the atelier. We also offer virtual fitting.

settings.question: Where are you located?
settings.answer:
We are located at:
263 Bowery 
New York, NY 10002

settings.question: How do I determine my head size?
settings.answer:
With a cloth tape measure start at the center front of the forehead. Hold the tape firm, then pull around to the ear, at the angle desired above the ear. Continue under your occipital bone which is located in the back of your head, then back around following the same procedure ending at the starting point.
You will either have inches or centimeters depending on the type of tape measure used.
For more infos CLICK HERE to discover our video instruction

settings.question: How often will my hat need to be re-shaped and/or cleaned?
settings.answer: It is recommended to have your hat cleaned and blocked at the beginning and end of each season.

settings.question: Do you have any everyday care advice?
settings.answer: Click here to visit our hat care page, we explain the best way to care for your felt and straw hat.

settings.question: Can I customize any of the hat from the e-shop?
settings.answer: Yes since all our hats are handmade at our atelier, we can dye specific colors and add any specific adornments all at additional costs.

settings.question: How long does it take to custom make a hat?
settings.answer: We require a 4-6 weeks lead time, depending on the project. There are rush options with a 60% surcharge of the total price of the hat added.

settings.question: Can you dye any color?
settings.answer: Yes all colors can be dyed at additional costs.

settings.question: Can I launch a custom order over the phone?
settings.answer: For such a process it is best to schedule a personal consultation with our Mad hatter Orlando to meet your expectations. Click here to fill out the form.

settings.question: I have an extremely large and odd shape head, is it possible to make my own block?
settings.answer: Orlando Palacios, our creative director and Master Hatter started as a Hat Block Maker over 28 years ago, therefore a block can be made specifically for you. For this, we would need to schedule  personal consultation at our NY atelier. To book your appointment please click here.

settings.question: Do you do Film or Theatre work?
settings.answer: From Boardwalk Empire to Strangers Things we are always delighted to collaborate with notable costume designers and Stylists to create the perfect Hat for the show.

settings.privacyExplanation: El Fino Hat Corporation doing business as Hatshop.com (”Worth & Worth", “El Fino” "we", "our", "us") respect the privacy rights of its online visitors/customers ("you", "your", "yours") and recognize the importance of protecting the information collected about them. We will only use the information that we collect about you lawfully (in accordance with the Data Protection Act 1998).The following information is provided by Worth & Worth to enable our online visitors/customers to be fully informed and reassured of our company privacy policies in line with all laws governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of The United States of America. By visiting Hatshop.com, you are accepting and consenting to the practices described in this Privacy Policy and the Terms and Conditions. Please note that this policy applies to El Fino and/or its subsidiaries, but not to websites maintained by other companies or organizations to which we link or engage in joint promotions. El Fino is not responsible for any personal information you submit to third parties via our website. Please ensure that you read the Privacy Policy of such other companies or organizations before submitting your details. Furthermore, from time to time El Fino may engage with third party business partners to collect personal information on El Fino’s behalf in the form of joint promotion ventures. In such cases, these third parties will be subject to confidentiality agreements and instructed by El Fino to comply fully with the El Fino Privacy Policy as set forth herein. All queries relating to any company policies should be sent to: El Fino Hat Corporation, 263 Bowery, New York, NY 10002 and call 212-265-2887 with any company policy or privacy queries.

settings.privacyTitle: COLLECTING INFORMATION AND HOW WE USE IT
settings.privacyExplanation:
We collect information from you when you subscribe to our mailing list for either email subscription or postal promotions. The purpose of the subscription is to gather details so that we can provide you with up to date information on our products and services which you have requested from us. We operate an opt-in policy in terms of communicating via email, post, and telephone. By subscribing to our mailing list, you are opting to receive communications by email. However, every time we contact you after this, you will have an opportunity to unsubscribe from our mailing list. At the point at which we collect your telephone and address details when you subscribe to our mailing list, you will be offered the opportunity to opt in to receive further communications by post and telephone. All such persons and companies are subject to confidentiality agreements, and protection of your personal data shall be ensured at all times in accordance with applicable data protection and privacy laws. Your personal data will not be sold to any database companies. Should you choose to have your name and personal data removed from our database all together, you can do so by clicking the unsubscribe link on the email or sending an email to info@hatshop.com or by writing to us at: El Fino Hat Corporation 247 West 38th Street, Third Floor
New York, NY, 10018

Hatshop.com requests personal information from you when you place an order, or register for a service offered by El Fino Hat Corp., or a third party affiliate/partner. If an order is placed with us, we will request personal information including your name, email address, phone numbers, home address, shipping and credit card billing address(es) so that we can process, fraud check and deliver your order. Details of your address and also the telephone number and email you have provided us, will be shared with our courier partner UPS, these details have been shared to assist in providing you with 1st class delivery service and will not be used by this third party for any other reasons. You may also choose to store your credit card details with us. Your card payment details will be automatically saved after each new transaction. Saved card details will never be shared with third parties and will only be used to process your order, using our payment partner's systems, your full card number will be encrypted and not visible to any El Fino Hat Corporation employees. Should you wish to opt out of storing this information, you can remove these details through MY ACCOUNT facility of the site. Your telephone number may be given to our courier partner for delivery services. These details allow us to process your order and to let you know the status of your order. You will not be contacted by telephone for any other reason than your order status and unless you have otherwise specifically requested.

A cookie is a piece of information that is stored by your computer's hard drive by your web browser which tracks your movements within websites. Most browsers are automatically set to accept cookies but you are able to alter the settings of your browser to prevent automatic acceptance, should you wish. Our site uses cookies to keep track of how often you visit our site, the contents of your shopping cart, previous purchases and to deliver content specific to your interests, to assist us in updating our service for our customers benefit. If you choose not to receive cookies, you may still use most of the features of our website, including the ability to purchase items. The use of cookies is an industry standard but should you require any further information regarding the technical specifications, please email info@hatshop.com.

settings.privacyTitle: WHO DO I CONTACT IF I HAVE A COMPLAINT?
settings.privacyExplanation: Please go to the Contact Us section of the web site and send an email to info@hatshop.com. If you wish to talk to an El Fino Hat Corp./Worth & Worth customer care representative please call 212-265-2887

By visiting Hatshop.com, you are accepting and consenting to the practices described in this Privacy Policy and the Terms and Conditions.

At Worth & Worth we firmly stand beside our product and craftsmanship while guaranteeing your satisfaction. Our return policy is simple, you have 14 days from the date of the reception of your purchase to return for store credit or exchange any item bought online via Hatshop.com or through the Worth & Worth by Orlando Palacios NY store.

We are unable to offer store credits on products that have been made to order, or customized. However, we will work with you on the piece and try to meet your requirements should an order not meet your expectations. We will not commission another hat gratis nor will we exchange the item.

Disclosure of Personal Data: In the preceding 12 months, we have disclosed the following categories of personal data for business to the following categories of recipients:In the preceding 12 months, we have disclosed the following categories of personal data for business to the following categories of recipients:

Category of Personal DataCategories of Recipients

Identifiers - Advertising networks, marketing partners, data analytics providers, market research platform, payment processors, fulfillment partners, customer support partners, Internet service providers, operating systems and platforms, other users, fraud prevention partners, cloud service providers, technical maintenance and system security providers

Commercial Information - Data analytics providers, advertising networks, marketing partners, market research platform, payment processors, fulfillment partners, customer support partners, and fraud prevention partners, cloud service provider

Characteristics of Protected Classifications under state or federal law, such as age - Advertising networks, marketing partners, market research platform, other users, customer feedback platforms

Internet or other electronic network activity - Advertising networks, marketing partners, data analytics providers, Internet service providers, operating systems and platforms, cloud service providers, fraud prevention partners, technical maintenance and system security providers

Geolocation data - Advertising networks, marketing partners, data analytics providers, Internet service providers, operating systems and platforms

Audio, electronic, visual, or similar information - Customer support partners, market research platform, facility security partners

Inferences - Advertising networks, data analytics providers, customer support partners, fraud prevention partners, cloud service providers

Sale of Personal Data: California law requires that we provide transparency about personal data we "sell," which for the purposes of the CCPA broadly means scenarios in which we have shared personal data with third parties in exchange for valuable consideration. El Fino Hat Corporation does not sell your personal data to other companies for money; however, we do allow our advertising partners to collect certain information to show you ads that are targeted to your interests, which may be considered a “sale” in California. In the preceding 12 months, we have allowed our advertising partners to collect identifiers, commercial information, and Internet or other electronic network activity information for targeted advertising purposes. You have the right to opt out of having your information used for targeted advertising at any time on www.hatshop.com by clicking here or by clicking the “Do Not Sell My Personal Information” link located in the footer of each respective page. We do not knowingly sell personal information about consumers under the age of 16.

Your Rights: In addition to the right to opt out of sales explained above, subject to certain limitations, California consumers have the right to (1) request to know more about the specific pieces and categories of personal data we collect, use, sell and disclose, (2) request deletion of their personal data, and (3) not be discriminated against for exercising their rights. You may make a request to know more about or delete your personal data by submitting this online form or emailing info@hatshop.com. Additionally, access requests under the CCPA can be made by calling 1-212-265-2887. We will verify your request by contacting you after receiving your request to verify your identity. Please note that we may retain certain information as required or permitted by applicable law. If you request to delete your personal data, certain of our products and services may no longer be available to you.

If we receive your request from an authorized agent, we may ask for evidence that you have provided such agent with a power of attorney or that the agent otherwise has valid written authority to submit requests to exercise rights on your behalf.

Notice of Financial Incentives: We offer various financial incentives. For example, we may provide discounts or other benefits to customers who sign up to receive our marketing emails. When you participate in a financial incentive, we collect personal data from you, such as identifiers like your name and email address. You can opt into a financial incentive by following the sign-up instructions, and you have the ability to opt-out of the incentive by contacting us. In some cases, we may provide additional terms and conditions for a financial incentive, which we will provide to you when you sign up. The value of your personal data is reasonably related to the value of the offer or discount presented to you.

Shine the Light: California law permits residents of California to request certain details about how their information is shared with third parties for direct marketing purposes or to opt out of such sharing. We do not share your personal data with third parties for their own direct marketing purposes.

settings.returnExplanation:
At Worth & Worth we firmly stand beside our product and craftsmanship while guaranteeing your satisfaction. Our return policy is simple, you have 14 days from the date of reception of your purchase to exchange or return for store credit any item bought online via Hatshop.com or through the Worth & Worth by Orlando Palacios NY store.

We take pride in the quality of our products and craftsmanship.  Our policy is to ensure that all products supplied reach you in perfect condition. If for any reason the product does not meet your expectations, we are happy to offer an exchange or store credit. 
We are unable to offer store credits on products that have been made to order or customized.  However, we will work with you on the piece and try to meet your requirements should an order not meet your expectations.  We will not commission another hat gratis nor will we exchange the item.

Return and Exchanges Process
For a return, contact us at info@hatshop.com using the subject "REQUEST RETURN". Add the description, size and colour of the item you wish to return in the body of the email. You can then return the products at your sole risk and expense using any safe and secured means to the following address:

Please send your returns to:
WORTH & WORTH BY ORLANDO PALACIOS
263 Bowery
New York, NY, 10002

– All returns must be in perfect condition
– We are unable to offer any exchanges or store credits on items that have been worn, marked or damaged or that are not in their undamaged original packaging.
– If you wish to have an exchange or report a faulty item please contact  info@hatshop.com
A store credit will be issued via gift card  within 5 days of receipt of the return. This refund will include the full value of the items returned, including US taxes and excluding shipping costs.

For an exchange, contact us at info@hatshop.com using the subject “REQUEST EXCHANGE".

Add the description, size and colour of the item you wish to exchange in the body of the email. We will send you a pre-paid shipping label to send the item back to us if the sale item is above $300. Upon exchanging a product under $300, you will be eligible to pay a new postage charge if applicable. As soon as we receive it, we will send your alternative choice.

settings.shippingExplanation:
For domestic shipments in United States, we offer 4 shipping method for orders dispatched via UPS.

Each method will directly effect the timeliness of your delivery.

Please note the prices below are approximate ranging from the East coast to the West coast in the United States. Your final shipping coast is calculated during checkout. It varies per state and per order depending on the size of the required box.

Please see the checkout for accurate pricing.
Ground shipping: $9 - $16
3 Day Select: $25 - $67
2nd Day Air: $30 - $94
Next Day Air Saver: $44 - $140

We also offer international shipments:

International Priority 7-15 days Expedited 4-7 days
For all international shipments, returns and exchanges, the customer is responsible for all postage, Duties & Taxes. 

Should you need any further information, please do not hesitate to contact our customer service team at info@hatshop.com

By accessing the website, you warrant and represent to the Website Owner that you are legally entitled to do so and to make use of information made available via the website.

11.1 PROMOTIONS

11.1.1 WHAT ARE THEY?

Discounts are issued in the form of either “$” savings' or a “percentage off” and are offered to customers via promotional emails, advertisements, on-site banners or 3rd party communications. There is no cash alternative and all terms and conditions are non-negotiable. Unless otherwise stated, discounts are only applicable to full price items (sale and clearance items are not included). Hatshop.com reserves the right to cancel or change any promotion / discount without notice, at any time.

11.1.2 FREE SHIPPING OFFERS

Free Shipping offers apply to “Standard US Shipping”, “Next Day Delivery” or “Free International Shipping” only, unless otherwise stated. In all cases, the shipping charge only will be deducted. No taxes, duties or customs charges will be removed. International Free shipping offers apply only when the "Standard UPS Service" is selected. If an alternative shipping option is chosen, the cost of the advertised free shipping charge only will be removed. We are unable to cover the cost of returning international orders

11.1.3 EXCLUSIONS + EXPIRIES

All promotions will have a “valid until” or “expiration” date. Please refer to the original promotion source for this information. Promotional codes cannot be used in conjunction with any other offer. Promotional codes are valid for one transaction per person and cannot be used on multiple accounts. Promotional codes cannot be applied retrospectively to previous orders.

11.1.4 HOW DO I USE THEM?

If using a promotional code, the code provided should be entered in the “Promotional Code” box at the checkout. Some promotions will be subject to a minimum spending threshold (please refer to the original source of the promotion). Wherever a minimum spending threshold applies, the minimum spend does not include shipping costs

11.1.5 RETURNING AN ITEM BOUGHT UNDER A PROMOTION

If returning an item purchased using a promotional code, the code used will remain valid if the retained items exceed the threshold required (if a threshold is applicable). If the retained items fall below the minimum spend you will be refunded accordingly and the code will be re-validated, this will happen on one occasion only. The re-validated code will expire after 14 days. We do not cover the cost of returning any items purchased under a promotion

12.1 ENTIRE AGREEMENT

These website terms and conditions constitute the sole record of the agreement between you and the Website Owner in relation to your use of the website. Neither you nor the Website Owner shall be bound by any express tacit or implied representation, warranty, promise or the like not recorded herein. Unless otherwise specifically stated these website terms and conditions supersede and replace all prior commitments, undertakings or representations, whether written or oral, between you and the Website Owner in respect of your use of the website.

You acknowledge that by visiting the website from time to time, you shall become bound to the current version of the relevant terms and conditions (the "current version") and, unless stated in the current version, all previous versions shall be superseded by the current version. You shall be responsible for reviewing the current version each time you visit the website.

12.3 CONFLICT

Where any conflict or contradiction appears between the provisions of these website terms and conditions and any other relevant terms and conditions, policies or notices, the other relevant terms and conditions, policies or notices which relate specifically to a particular section or module of the website shall prevail in respect of your use of the relevant section or module of the website.

12.4 WAIVER

No indulgence or extension of time which either you or the Website Owner may grant to the other will constitute a waiver of or, limit any of the existing or future rights of the grantor in terms hereof, save in the event or to the extent that the grantor has signed a written document expressly waiving or limiting such rights.

12.5 CESSION

The Website Owner shall be entitled to cede, assign and delegate all or any of its rights and obligations in terms of any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices to any third party.

12.6 SEVERABILITY

All provisions of any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices are, notwithstanding the manner in which they have been grouped together or linked grammatically, severable from each other. Any provision of any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices, which is or becomes unenforceable in any jurisdiction, whether due to voidness, invalidity, illegality, unlawfulness or for any reason whatever, shall, in such jurisdiction only and only to the extent that it is so unenforceable, be treated as pro non-script and the remaining provisions of any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices shall remain in full force and effect.

12.7 APPLICABLE LAWS

Any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of The United States of America and its territories without giving effect to any principles of conflict of law. You hereby consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of The United States of America in respect of any disputes arising in connection with the website, or any relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices or any matter related to or in connection therewith.

12.8 COMMENTS OR QUESTIONS

If you have any questions, comments or concerns arising from the website, the Privacy Policy or any other relevant terms and conditions, policies and notices or the way in which we are handling your personal information please contact us.

settings.title: Craft the perfect hat to call your very own
settings.content:
As one of the oldest shops in The United States, Worth & Worth has built its reputation on quality, client service and dedication. We value the relationships forged with our patrons. As one of the oldest shops in The United States, Worth & Worth has built its reputation on quality, client service and dedication. We value the relationships forged with our patrons.

A hat is one of the most personal pieces of clothing/accessories that one can wear, so why not invest in something that will fit no other head but yours? We pride ourselves on making the perfect hat for any head size, shape, or personality.

settings.formSubTitle: For custom projects, book an appointment:
settings.formContent: Worth & Worth makes men's and women's made-to-measure hats of all kinds within 3 to 4 weeks. For a personal consultation on crafting your one-of-a-kind piece with our designer and owner Orlando Palacios, please provide us with your information and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

settings.careersIntro: As a fast growing company we are always searching for enthusiastic, driven and innovative people who are passionate about our brand and trust in our vision.

settings.jobDesc: Whether it’s top coats and menswear or sculpture and installation, all reflect a prodigious and deeply personal passion for artwork based on the human form.
Whether it’s top coats and menswear or sculpture and installation, all reflect a prodigious and deeply personal passion for artwork based on the human form.

settings.paidContent: Orlando Palacios is the artist, master craftsman and the proprietor behind the storied NY brand Worth & Worth. Founded in 1922, Worth & Worth is one of three remaining custom hat makers in the United States. A boutique operation that purveys a curated selection of fine headwear, as well as bespoke creator of tailored tops and restorer of archival fashions. Above all, Palacios is an artist with a truly unusual range of expression. Whether it’s top coats and menswear or sculpture and installation, all reflect a prodigious and deeply personal passion for artwork based on the human form.
settings.paidInstructions: Interested in applying to any of our internship programs? Please send your resume to info@hatshop.com with the season you would like to apply for in the subject line.

settings.paidContent: Orlando Palacios is the artist, master craftsman and the proprietor behind the storied NY brand Worth & Worth. Founded in 1922, Worth & Worth is one of three remaining custom hat makers in the United States. A boutique operation that purveys a curated selection of fine headwear, as well as bespoke creator of tailored tops and restorer of archival fashions. Above all, Palacios is an artist with a truly unusual range of expression. Whether it’s top coats and menswear or sculpture and installation, all reflect a prodigious and deeply personal passion for artwork based on the human form.
settings.paidInstructions: Please send your resume to info@hatshop.com and be sure to reference your desired position in the subject line.

settings.contactTitle: We are here when you need us

settings.title: Our New York flagship store and atelier
settings.intro: There's a Master Hatter inconspicuously crafting his own special brew of magic downtown Manhattan, smack-dab in the middle of The legendary Bowery, New York.

settings.formDesc: To send us a message, please fill out the form below. We'll get back to you shortly!

settings.textOnlyHeader: There’s a Master Hatter inconspicuously crafting his own special brew of magic smack-dab in the middle of the world’s largest central business and media district.
settings.textOnlyContent:
Fashion is as eternal as the human need for clothing. But hats remain a discretionary element in the modern age. A hat today reflects the true essence of its wearer far more than does a pair of fitted trousers, shoes or a tailored jacket. To wear a hat is a genuine statement of character and personality in our times, and the boldest among us seem to lead, quite literally, with their heads.

From the superfine, centuries-old Ecuadorian panamas to the refined handcrafted felt hats, we are committed to satisfying each of our patrons and their unique needs. And because our product is handmade, your satisfaction is guaranteed. We stand firmly behind our product and craftsmanship while looking to meet the expectations of every single one of our clients.

settings.textOnlyContent2: Orlando Palacios is the artist, master craftsman and the proprietor behind the storied NY brand Worth & Worth. Founded in 1922, Worth & Worth is one of three remaining custom hat makers in the United States. A boutique operation that purveys a curated selection of fine headwear, as well as bespoke creator of tailored tops and restorer of archival fashions. Above all, Palacios is an artist with a truly unusual range of expression. Whether it’s top coats and menswear or sculpture and installation, all reflect a prodigious and deeply personal passion for artwork based on the human form.

settings.textRightIntro: In 1922, Worth & Worth founder, John Margulies, had a vision to change the way people viewed and shopped for hats.
settings.textRightContent:
The idea was to create a hat brand that offered a collection of distinctive styles and colors for every type of client.

Worth & Worth hats were designed specifically to fit a person's face and build. This formula was used to essentially capture the client's essences. They were first sold exclusively at Saks & Co until the first Worth & Worth store opened later that year at 1572 Broadway. Since then, Worth & Worth has been establishing a legacy of excellence and high-level craftsmanship.

settings.textLeftIntro: 1936 marked the year of expansion of the  Worth & Worth brand.
settings.textLeftContent: A new store opened at 603 fifth Avenue, where the company occupied all five floors of the building. Worth & Worth also debuted a complete line of men's apparel that was carried exclusively in the new location. With three stores in the heart of New York City, Worth & Worth quickly grew to become a staple in New York's menswear fashion community.

settings.textRightIntro: In 1948, Worth & Worth celebrated it's silver anniversary.
settings.textRightContent: For twenty five years John Margulies, president of Worth & Worth, built a brand that was patronized by entertainment and sports personalities amongst many others. During this time Worth & Worth found a life-long clients in legendary musician Frank Sinatra and the exceptional movie start Humphrey Bogart. The passion in which Mr. Sinatra exuded through his music was equally matched by Mr. Margulies' passion for the finest hats in the world.

settings.textLeftIntro: Harvey Kane, Worth & Worth lining supplier and long time client purchased the company in 1959.
settings.textLeftContent: Under Harvey's ownership the company continued its expansion opening a new store at the Astor Hotel following by the Madison avenue store. Harvey Kane had a vision for the brand and saw the potential in what the company would later become. During that time Worth & Worth's client base and mind share over the market continued to expand at a rapid pace earning it the reputation as the best hatshop in NYC.

settings.textRightIntro: In 1974, Worth & Worth garnered mass amounts of attention within the pop-culture when they were seen worn by international pop and rock pioneers as David Bowie among others.
settings.textRightContent: During that time legendary Hollywood actress Elizabeth Taylor was also photographed wearing hats by Worth & Worth. The company had now become a staple brand loved and respected by the biggest names in music, sports, television and film.

settings.textLeftIntro: In 1980, Harry Rosenholtz, an apprentice of the company developed such a love for the brand and Harvey's Daughter that he married both
settings.textLeftContent:
Harry bought the company and became the third owner of Worth & Worth. Armed with new marketing strategies and enthusiasm, Harry was determined to make Worth & Worth a nationally recognized brand, by capitalizing on the brand's growing presence in pop-culture.

Under Harry's leadership, Worth & Worth launched it's first catalogue introducing new colors and styles.He also worked with growing fashion designers such as Ralph Lauren and Yohji Yamamoto's to collaborate on W&W product placement within their respective campaigns. That year Worth & Worth was acknowledged as the oldest hat shop in New York City.

In 1983, Worth and Worth was honored as Hatter of the Year by the Headwear Institute of America; a dedication to continue its tradition of great quality and superb service.

settings.textRightIntro: In 1980, Harry Rosenholtz, an apprentice of the company developed such a love for the brand and Harvey's Daughter that he married both.
settings.textRightContent: Harry bought the company and became the third owner of Worth & Worth. Armed with new marketing strategies and enthusiasm, Harry was determined to make Worth & Worth a nationally recognized brand, by capitalizing on the brand's growing presence in pop-culture.

settings.textLeftIntro: Harry Rosenholtz had always envisioned the company establishing a presence outside New York City and in 1993 Worth & Worth opened it's Boston store.
settings.textLeftContent: The following year, it's second location opened in Chicago. This was a major milestone for the New York City based brand. The growth of Worth & Worth was documented in popular news publications including The New Yorker, New York Times, and New York magazine.

settings.textRightIntro: Worth & Worth welcomed it's fourth and current owner.
settings.textRightContent:
Orlando Palacios assumed control as a talented conceptual artist and hat designer from Los Angeles. As a master craftsman, Palacios started his own company in 1990 by supplying hand-carved, wooden hat forms for the hat industry across Europe and South America.

Orlando's fresh new approach, creativity, and ingenuity kept the brands 80 year old reputation intact while gaining significant notoriety from a new generation.

settings.textLeftIntro: Worth & Worth started to see an uptick in interest coming from the fashion industry.
settings.textLeftContent: Collection collaborations and campaign partnerships with designers such as Custo Barcelona, Phillip Lim, and Louis Vuitton were starting to take place more frequently.Hats by W&W were featured on celebrities such as Ashley Olsen, Beyonce, Sean Connery, and Elvis Costello to name a few. Vanity Fair Magazine's annual Hollywood issue featured Worth & Worth hats in a ten page editorial highlighting the most popular actors and actresses of the year. Also, Orlando Palacios was featured in Time- Out magazine as one of the most stylish New Yorker's of the year while Rolling Stone magazine named Worth & Worth The Rock and Roll Haberdasher. This was also the year Worth & Worth celebrated opening a new workshop and showroom at the current location of 45 West 57th Street in midtown NYC.

settings.textRightIntro: Worth & Worth celebrated 90 years of excellence and dedication to fine handcrafted hats in 2012.
settings.textRightContent: Numerous fashion publications including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Instyle magazine featured the brand and product throughout their pages. Worth & Worth was also covered by news publication New York Times, LA Times, and New York magazine with regard to the notoriety and reputation that had been built throughout the tenure of Orlando Palacios. During this time collaborations with fashion designers DVF, Thom Browne, Oscar De La Renta, and John Varvatos started to solidify the mind share of Worth & Worth. Hats were featured in movies and shows such as J. Edgar, starring Leonardo Dicaprio and Boardwalk Empire, staring Steve Buschemi and Michael Shannon . The brand also garnered the loyal support from a large list of celebrity clientele including The Rolling Stones Keith Richards, Sports-star Kobe Bryant, Actress Emma Watson, Supermodel Christie Brinkley and many others.

settings.textLeftIntro: To protect the spirit of a creative visionary superbly in touch with his time and at the top of his craft, Orlando launched a new communication platform for Worth & Worth, in January 2013.
settings.textLeftContent:
A new brand image with a vibrant website, bring to life a new fresh perspective on Orlando's work.

The W&W new campaign "Underneath my hat" aims to show an authentic and intimate moment with Worth & Worth's icons by a serie of snapshots into the character's life. This original and poetic portrait through the hat's narration started in Los Angeles in 2012. Worth & Worth's icons are musicians, professionals, hairdressers, movie makers, artists, producers... They have a strong personality with a sense of style, passionate in what they do. The reportage will continue to highlight W&W's customers throughout United States.

settings.quote:
"He doesn't say much but he's a real nice guy. 
We met at the beach he was waxing his board
at the point. Like I said, I was caught between
two rocks, he pulled me out, Put me on his head
"fit just right" He surfed all morning...
Later on, we took a ride in his Expedition, 
he placed me on his dashboard.
"Pilots,  feels like a Coney Island ride".
After a few locations, we stopped by his pad
in the hills  He's got a wife, a son and jukebox
M5: their favorite "the king" For dinner we gather
from his garden, they eat what they reap
Swells coming south southwest." From Montecristi Leo Carillo

settings.playlist: The Stooges, Neil Young, The Guess Who, Neil Young & Crazy Horse, Roy Acuff, Tony Allen, The Blues Busters

settings.quote:
It's easy to become overwhelmed by this city's vastness, but if you take it in small doses and look for its heart, it's incredibly romantic. You can pretend to be whoever you want to be... Getting lost is the best part of it. 

The basis for all of my work always seems to sprout from a piece of music. For me that's a quintessential part of living here. Driving and letting wherever you are dictate the soundtrack.

settings.playlist: Bob Dylan, The Dead Weather, Father John Misty, The Kills, Timber Timbre, Sebastien Tellier, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, TV on the Radio
settings.playlistURL: <iframe height="315" width="560" src="https://play.soundsgood.co/embed/5d1c15d3ab96183f8df5aa15?hideTitle=1&hideCurator=1" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen="" mozallowfullscreen="" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowtransparency="true"></iframe>

settings.quote:
"We are both very low Maintenance
And always on the go...
We travel the Peaks and the Lowlands 
I am her Pillow, I am her shade.
We are each others shoulders to lean on..."
From the Jager Hat

settings.playlist: Honeybus, Pozo Seco Singers, Lijadu Sisters, Sally Goodin, Blue Sky Boys, Velvet Underground, Jane Birkin

settings.quote:
I was born in Colorado
The youngest of 5 in the only hospital in town.
Moving to and living in LA has been and continues to be one of the most challenging aspects of my life
You have to learn to be alone
I am trying to spend more time alone now.

Love this self time.

settings.playlist: Pink Floyd, Fern Kinney, Video Age, Gloria Anne Taylor, Midnight Sister, Saada Bonaire, Harumi, Maria, Letta Mbulu

settings.quote:
"He is like a surgeon: Cuts fast and precise.
The kitchen fills with a kaleidoscope
of colors and a melange of scents and smells...
He writes, I think, he sits, I dream
We’re rarely apart from each other
We are a good-natured, unconventional, neighborly pair.
Our life together is eccentric
I couldn't find my head without him."
From The Montage Hat.

settings.playlist: Bright Eyes, Queen, Tom Waits, Iggy Pop & Francoise Hardy, Jacques Brel, Pink Floyd, Dvorak, Spacehog

settings.quote:
We get together on Sundays Josiah can pluck and tune
anything from a chicken to a double bass from a
66 Corvair to a Dreadnought Martin. We keep the time.
Cris. He is the peacekeeper. Cord to cord, note to note,
an even keel every beat of the way. Catherine. She is Melody
in motion. She can hail a cab  with a whistle that
shrieks like finger nails on a chalkboard or hum a tune
that can soothe the chaos of a nursery  full of crying
children. Cadence and Climax Antony. Once you have the
melody the harmony and the rhythm... All you need is
soul... and a bit of a rabble-rouser.

settings.playlist: John Coltrane, Serge Gainsbourg and Brigitte Bardot, Procol Harum, David Bowie, Tears for Fears, Iggy Pop & Francoise Hardy
Brian Ferry, Talking Heads, Beatles, Brian Eno, Erik Satie, Dolly Parton, Sonic Youth

settings.title: It is said one wears many hats in our lifetime

settings.quote:
Through the view of her many hats...
Sometimes she goes by Willie
hard core and edgy the street is her school…
She's a seeker willing to travel
at the drop of a hat.
A seductive nymph who never
needs to be on a guest list.

Sleeky sensual intriguing legend
tells it she walks through walls

settings.playlist: Brian Ferry, Talking Heads, Beatles, Brian Eno, Erik Satie, Dolly Parton, Sonic Youth

settings.quote:
"I sit in front of the mirror a hand length from
my head. As he preps for the day, I am chic
dark and tall. We are a match. He is meticulous
of his wears and grooming. It never seems that a
hair is never out of place without reason. There are
two things he gathers before he leaves his flat:
his long board and me. I go first, he carefully grabs
me by the brim, twirls me in his fingers with a dancers grace. Faces the mirror places me on his head.
He adjusts me firm and elegant with a jaunty angle to
the face. With a self confident he looks to the mirror.
He grasps the board and we are out the door.
At the street he drops the board, places left foot
first, checks my fit and we kick off. I ride tall and
above all to see and be seen."
From his W&W Custom hats

settings.playlist: Barrett Strong, Garfield Fleming, Stevie Wonder, The Voices Of East Harlem, Marvin Gaye, Ashford & Simpson

settings.description: Grateful to be able to share our story, our passion and dedication to a beautiful art that is thankfully not lost yet.

settings.textCenter4a: Our Montecristi Hats made by centuries old process

settings.textRightsubheader: " It was like going back into time: there was little fuel so people were traveling by oxen and horses... "
settings.textRightContent: Orlando was born in Los Angeles. His family is originally from the village of Santa Teresa in Nicaragua. After the revolution, Orlando returned back to Nicaragua for a visit.

settings.textLeftsubheader: " Growing up a punk teen in the 80's in LA was fresh, fast and rebellious... We would head to the Salvation Army... "
settings.textLeftContent: He grew up during the punk era in the 80’s when he cultivated his first taste of fashion. Trawling through the dollar bins of vintage thrift shops, this was Orlando’s first step.

settings.textRightsubheader: " I had put an ad in the hat trade paper advertising with my new profession: "Hat block maker". I got a few hits locally and started on my path "
settings.textRightContent: In 1990, Orlando started his own company by carving wooden hat forms for the hat industries, all across Europe and South America. While carving abroad, he discovered his passion for the art of hat-making.

settings.textLeftsubheader: " Business had really started to pick up and I had to get a larger space. Joe The super and I had been having coffee's together in the mornings... "
settings.textLeftContent: 3 years later, he decided to leave California to start his career as an artist and hat-maker in New York City. He moved into his loft in Hell’s kitchen, created his own space and from there, carved out a new life & home.

settings.textRightsubheader: " I had received a phone call from Harry Rosenholtz, the owner of Worth & Worth at the time... We met at my old loft in hell's kitchen. "
settings.textRightContent: After meeting and working with the owners of Worth & Worth for several years, Orlando purchased the company in 1999 and became the owner and head-designer of the renowned New York haberdashery.

settings.textLeftContent: Orlando engineered the revitalization of Worth & Worth by introducing the art of hat-making to the business. He then decided to move the showroom and his atelier, to its present and historic 57th street location. By operating out of a small showroom and advertising strictly through word-of-mouth, he re-established the brand and maintained the integrity of Worth & Worth..

settings.textRightsubheader: " When Paul arrived we greeted and proceeded down the hall way to the atelier we call “the kitchen”. I had heard Paul was working on a new album. So, I asked Paul... "
settings.textRightContent: Orlando’s hats have been donned by some of the most notable people in our culture today including Keith Richards, Sir Paul Simon and David Mamet, to name of few. He continues his endeavor to make quality a main component of his styles and designs. Rolling Stone Magazine named Worth & Worth “The Hot Rock & Roll Haberdasher”.

settings.header: Orlando Palacios is a heralded and creative artist based in New York City.
settings.content:
Orlando has spent the past 20 years designing and manufacturing the finest handcrafted hats for fashion designers, celebrities, Broadway shows and stylish people from around the world. As the owner and head designer of the venerable New York haberdashery, Worth and Worth, he has grown to be the go-to lid-crafter for musicians ranging from Keith Richards to Elvis Costello and Beyoncé.

He often collaborates with fashion designers such as John Varvatos, Thom Browne, Robert Geller and Diane Von Furstenberg for their runway presentations. His passion for the craft enables him to keep the art of hat-making alive by using the same centuries-old techniques while the innovation and style of his designs remains unchallenged.
settings.outro: READ MORE ABOUT THE LIFE & TIMES OF ORLANDO PALACIOS

settings.beaverfeltBannerDescription: Connect and value the objects you possess. We don’t need more. What we need is objects we care about, objects with soul and history. Handmade with love

settings.handdyeBannerDescriptionR:
..."Is produced from an herb: they take this herb without roots and put it in a big tub and add water and leave it until the herb is all rotted. Then they leave it in the sun, which is very hot and makes it evaporate and coagulate into a paste. Then it is chopped up into small pieces, as you have seen."
Marco Polo, 1292

settings.montecristiBannertitleR: Our Montecristi is made by a centuries-old process

settings.servicePrice: We are happy to announce that our NYC store is open Mondays to Fridays from 10 am to 6 pm for consultations and in-person fitting following social distancing.  We are available at  info@hatshop.com or by phone +1 (212) 265-2887. We are also available via our social channels. We are here when you need us.

Please feel free to contact us at +1 (212) 265-2887 from Mondays to Saturdays. We are here to answer your questions, set up a virtual consultation with Orlando, discuss best sizing practices, Hat fittings and custom projects with you.

- We’re wearing face masks and require that you wear one too—for your own health and safety, as well as that of everyone else.
- We’ll have hand sanitizer available at the entrance of our store.
- We’re limiting store capacity. Due to recent regulations and to ensure enough space for social distancing, we’re only letting a certain number of people in our store at one time, which means you may have to wait to enter. We really appreciate your patience.
- We’re limiting store hours to allow us extra time to sanitize everything properly.
- We’re cleaning frequently. We're sanitizing all high-touch surfaces with disinfectant frequently while the store is open, in accordance with the CDC’s guidelines.
- We’re quarantining all returned merchandise and Hat Repairs for 48 hours then cleaning it and steaming before returning our creations to sellable inventory.
- We’re monitoring the health of our teams and performing daily temperature checks.
Any other questions? Reach out to us at info@hatshop.com.

We are working hard to ensure you continue to experience the high-quality service that you have come to expect from Worth & Worth.
All the hats placed online will be fulfilled, we are just asking you to be patient as it might take a little bit longer to create and ship them your way.
We operate according to the guidelines of the World Health Organization and government authorities to constantly ensure that hygiene and sanitary standards are respected.
We have extended our return policy to 30 days. If your return is at risk of falling outside of this window, please reach out to info@hatshop.com for more information.

As of today, there has been no disruption to our shipping services, and we expect your orders to arrive on time, as planned in the US.
We are processing all orders as usual and are still sending expedited when selected, but ask customers to anticipate the possibility of external delays with our shipping partners.

Also please note that most of our hats are handmade and the current lead time to completion is 4 weeks.

Due to COVID–19, there may be a delay in delivery and a temporary increase in shipping costs. Some international destinations have suspended delivery during this period- please reach out to us for further updates.

settings.mainp: We are working hard to ensure you continue to experience the high-quality service that you have come to expect from Worth & Worth.
settings.secondp:
Our Flagship store is now open Mondays to Saturdays 10 am to 6 pm. Unfortunately we are not  able to accept Hat Repair at this time. The health, safety and comfort of you all and our team has been our top priority throughout COVID-19. 
Please do not hesitate to contact us at 212 265 2887 if you have any questions.

settings.heading: We know the world is looking a little different these days. Here’s how we’re responding to COVID-19
settings.bopdy:
While COVID-19 continues to impact the health, safety and everyday life of people and businesses around the world, we would like to share the steps we are taking as a company to protect you, our staff and our community. We are carefully following the guidelines and best practices provided by the World Health Organization and government authorities to constantly ensure that hygiene and sanitary standards are respected.

The health, safety and comfort of you all and our team has been our top priority throughout COVID-19. So we’ve taken lots of time making a new process that’ll ensure as much, and we’ll keep monitoring conditions as they change. Our store remains open and orders are being fulfilled routinely from our NY Ateliers. We thank you for your patience while we are fulfilling your orders. We will be sending you a tracking number once your hat will be shipped.

We thank you for your continued support during this time and are thinking of you and your families.

settings.title: Schedule your complimentary fitting experience with our Head-designer Orlando
